item.title: 巴西淡水河谷公司确认 2030 年前将向卡拉哈斯综合体投资 120 亿美元
item.description: 巴西矿业公司淡水河谷周五证实，该公司将在 2030 年前对其位于巴西北部的 Carajas 综合企业投资 700 亿雷亚尔（合 122.6 亿美元）。【原文：Brazilian miner Vale confirmed on Friday that it will invest 70 billion reais ($12.26 billion) in its Carajas complex in northern Brazil through 2030.】

item.title: 备忘录称，美国银行聘请摩根大通前高管加强私人银行业务
item.description: 据路透社周五看到的一份内部备忘录显示，美国银行已聘请摩根大通资深人士迈克-马里诺（Mike Marino）担任其私人银行乔治亚州市场主管。【原文：Bank of America has hired JPMorgan Chase veteran Mike Marino as the Georgia market executive of its private bank, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：戴尔接近达成向 xAI 出售 50 亿美元人工智能服务器的交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，戴尔科技公司即将达成一项价值超过 50 亿美元的交易，为埃隆-马斯克的 xAI 公司提供为人工智能工作优化的服务器。【原文：Dell Technologies is nearing a deal worth more than $5 billion to provide Elon Musk's xAI with servers optimized for artificial intelligence work, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国钻井商连续第三周增加油气钻机 - 贝克休斯
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯周五在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周连续第三周增加石油和天然气钻机，这是自2023年12月以来的首次。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week added oil and natural gas rigs for a third week in a row for the first time since December 2023, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 桥水增持特斯拉股份，减持 "华丽 7 号 "其他股份
item.description: 一份监管文件显示，对冲基金巨头桥水联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）第四季度在其投资组合中增持了特斯拉股票，同时削减了对美国科技股和成长股 "华丽七雄 "中其他股票的投资。【原文：Hedge fund giant Bridgewater Associates added shares of Tesla to its portfolio in the fourth quarter, while it trimmed exposure to the rest of the "Magnificent Seven" group of U.S. tech and growth stocks, a regulatory filing showed.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，Meta 计划投资人工智能驱动的仿人机器人
item.description: 据路透社周五浏览的一份公司内部备忘录显示，Meta Platforms 公司正在其现实实验室（Reality Labs）部门内成立一个新的部门，开发人工智能驱动的仿人机器人，以协助完成体力劳动。【原文：Meta Platforms is establishing a new division within its Reality Labs unit to develop AI-powered humanoid robots that can assist with physical tasks, according to an internal company memo viewed by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，欧盟将无条件批准诺基亚价值 23 亿美元的英飞朗交易
item.description: 知情人士周五透露，欧盟反垄断监管机构将无条件批准诺基亚以 23 亿美元收购美国光半导体和网络设备制造商英飞朗。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are set to clear without conditions Nokia's $2.3 billion acquisition of U.S. optical semiconductors and networking equipment maker Infinera , people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 白银搭乘黄金牛市的顺风车，直逼 10 年峰值
item.description: 白银价格周五创下 10 月下旬以来的新高，与黄金接连创下历史新高的因素相互吸引，一些分析师认为，白银投资者的目标可能是挑战略低于每盎司 35 美元的 10 年新高。【原文：Silver prices hit their highest since late October on Friday, latching on to factors that drove gold to successive record highs, with some analysts suggesting investors in the metal may aim to challenge a 10-year high just shy of $35 per ounce.】

item.title: 银行抛售更多 X 债务；目前账上仅剩 13 亿美元
item.description: 一位知情人士透露，以摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）为首的银行已向投资者出售了另一大部分贷款，这些贷款构成了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）2022 年以 440 亿美元收购 Twitter（即现在的 X）的 130 亿美元债务。【原文：Banks led by Morgan Stanley have sold to investors another chunky portion of loans that formed the $13 billion debt supporting Elon Musk's $44 billion acquisition of Twitter, now X, in 2022, a source with knowledge of the deal said.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国能源部大范围裁员，核安全和贷款办公室受到冲击
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士周五透露，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府已在能源部裁员约1200至2000人，其中包括核安全管理部门和贷款办公室的员工。【原文：The administration of U.S. President Donald Trump has laid off about 1,200 to 2,000 workers at the Department of Energy, including employees at the nuclear security administration and the loans office, two sources familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 本杰瑞称母公司联合利华要求对特朗普保持沉默
item.description: Ben & Jerry's指责其母公司联合利华要求其对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普保持沉默，因为它准备在今年晚些时候分拆该冰淇淋品牌。【原文：Ben & Jerry's accused its parent Unilever of demanding its silence toward U.S. President Donald Trump, as it prepares to spin off the ice cream brand later this year.】

item.title: Chainalysis 称，在人工智能的帮助下，加密货币诈骗可能在 2024 年创下新纪录
item.description: 区块链分析公司 Chainalysis 的数据显示，"杀猪 "骗局的兴起和人工智能生成技术的日益广泛使用，很可能使加密货币骗局的收入在 2024 年达到历史新高。【原文：The rise of "pig butchering" scams and the increasing use of generative artificial intelligence likely lifted revenues from crypto scams to a record high in 2024, according to blockchain analytics firm Chainalysis.】

item.title: 美国商业库存九个月来首次下降
item.description: 由于强劲的国内需求耗尽了零售商和批发商的库存，12 月份美国商业库存出现了九个月来的首次下降。【原文：U.S. business inventories fell for the first time in nine months in December as strong domestic demand depleted stocks at retailers and wholesalers.】

item.title: 美国 1 月制造业产出因汽车生产疲软而下降
item.description: 受汽车产量大幅下降的影响，1 月份美国制造业生产意外下降。【原文：U.S. manufacturing production unexpectedly fell in January, weighed down by a sharp decline in motor vehicle output.】

item.title: 华尔街有望实现周涨幅，市场关注关税问题
item.description: 周五，华尔街期货持稳，美元下跌，全球股市接近近期纪录高点，交易商在等待关税和乌克兰问题的进展。【原文：Wall Street futures were steady on Friday, the U.S. dollar fell and global stock markets held close to their recent record highs, as traders waited for developments on tariffs and Ukraine.】

item.title: 欧盟对关税谈判持开放态度，但坚定维护自身法律，资深立法者如是说
item.description: 欧洲议会贸易委员会主席周五表示，欧盟可以与美国就互惠关税问题进行谈判，但不会放弃在税收和数字平台等领域的监管权。【原文：The European Union can negotiate on reciprocal tariffs with the United States but will not give up its right to regulate in areas such as taxation and digital platforms, the chair of the European Parliament's trade committee said on Friday.】

item.title: 印度工业从特朗普的贸易目标中看到机遇
item.description: 在印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）会见美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）之后，印度工业和贸易专家看到了扩大与美国业务的机会，尽管互惠关税存在不确定性，但这要归功于过去几年采取的措施。【原文：Indian industry and trade experts see an opportunity to expand business with the U.S. after Prime Minister Narendra Modi met President Donald Trump, despite uncertainties over reciprocal tariffs and thanks to steps taken in the past few years.】

item.title: 印度削减波本威士忌关税，特朗普批评愈演愈烈
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评南亚市场的 "不公平 "征税之后，印度已将波本威士忌的关税从 150% 下调至 100%，此举将有利于三得利的 Jim Beam 等品牌的进口。【原文：India has slashed tariffs on bourbon whisky to 100% from 150%, a move that will benefit imports of brands like Suntory's Jim Beam, after U.S. President Donald Trump's criticised "unfair" levies in the South Asian market.】

item.title: 贝莱德将芬克的薪酬与私人市场扩张挂钩
item.description: 顶级资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周五表示，该公司已经改变了董事长兼首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）的薪酬方式，以反映该公司最近向私人市场的扩张，芬克去年率先向私人市场扩张。【原文：Top asset manager BlackRock said on Friday it has changed the way Chairman and CEO Larry Fink will be compensated to reflect the company's recent expansion into private markets, which Fink spearheaded last year.】

item.title: 美国 1 月份进口价格温和上涨
item.description: 由于燃料成本的飙升被汽车和消费品价格的下降部分抵消，1 月份美国进口价格的增幅略低于预期，这为抗击通胀带来了一些希望。【原文：U.S. import prices increased slightly less than expected in January as a surge in the cost of fuels was partially offset by decreases in the prices of motor vehicles and consumer goods, offering some hope in the fight against inflation.】

item.title: 意大利就亚马逊涉嫌逃税 12 亿欧元展开调查
item.description: 两名直接了解此事的消息人士周五称，意大利检察官正在调查电子商务巨头亚马逊及其三名高管涉嫌逃税的案件，涉案金额达 12 亿欧元（约合 12.6 亿美元）。【原文：Italian prosecutors are investigating e-commerce giant Amazon and three of its executives over alleged tax evasion worth 1.2-billion-euro ($1.26 billion), two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 发动机制造商赛峰集团对今年波音737 MAX的产量持乐观态度
item.description: 法国喷气发动机制造商赛峰集团的负责人周五表示，他确信波音公司将在今年实现737 MAX喷气机生产的关键里程碑。【原文：The head of French jet engine maker Safran said on Friday he was certain Boeing would reach key production milestones for the 737 MAX jet during this year.】

item.title: 巴西暗示将向世贸组织投诉，并在特朗普征收钢铁关税后对美国产品征税
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周五表示，巴西将对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收钢铁进口关税的决定作出反应，并暗示巴西政府可能向世界贸易组织提出申诉，或对美国产品征税。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Friday that Brazil would react to U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to issue tariffs on steel imports, suggesting his government could file a complaint at the World Trade Organization, or tax U.S. products.】

item.title: 美国 1 月份零售额大幅下降
item.description: 美国 1 月份的零售额降幅超过预期，这可能是因为寒冷的气温使消费者远离汽车展厅。【原文：U.S. retail sales fell more than expected in January, likely as frigid temperatures kept consumers from automobile showrooms.】

item.title: 美国财政部部长：美国正在研究关税争端中的货币操纵问题
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周五表示，特朗普政府在4月最后期限到来之前研究货币操纵问题时，不仅关注关税和非关税壁垒，还将研究货币操纵问题。【原文：The Trump administration is looking beyond tariffs and non-tariff barriers to examine currency manipulation as it studies the issue ahead of an April deadline, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Friday.】

item.title: 英伟达减持 Arm Holdings 股份，投资中国 WeRide 公司
item.description: 周五的一份监管文件显示，英伟达第四季度减持了英国芯片公司Arm Holdings约44%的股份，并退出了对Serve Robotics和SoundHound AI的持股。【原文：Nvidia reduced its stake in British chip firm Arm Holdings by about 44% and exited its holdings in Serve Robotics and SoundHound AI in the fourth quarter, a regulatory filing showed on Friday.】

item.title: 可口可乐欧洲太平洋伙伴公司因需求强劲而实现季度收入增长
item.description: 周五，可口可乐公司的装瓶部门可口可乐欧洲太平洋伙伴公司（Coca-Cola Europacific Partners）公布第四季度销售额增长 5%，主要得益于对高价饮料的强劲需求，尤其是在澳大利亚、太平洋和东南亚市场。【原文：Coca-Cola Europacific Partners , a bottling unit of Coca-Cola , reported a 5% rise in fourth-quarter sales on Friday, helped by strong demand for higher-priced beverages, especially in the Australia, Pacific and Southeast Asia markets.】

item.title: 标普全球表示，特朗普的北约支出要求可能会打击欧洲的信用评级
item.description: 评级公司S&P Global称，如果欧洲北约成员国按照美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的要求增加国防开支，那么它们的信用评级很可能会受到影响，尽管这可能会促使该地区联合发行债务。【原文：The credit ratings of Europe's NATO members are likely to suffer if they ramp up defence spending in line with U.S. President Donald Trump's demands although they might drive the region to jointly issue debt, ratings firm S&P Global has said.】

item.title: HBL 与标普全球发布巴基斯坦首个制造业采购经理指数
item.description: 巴基斯坦最大的银行 HBL 与全球金融信息和分析公司 S&P Global 周五表示，双方已推出一项新指数，以跟踪该国的制造业。【原文：Pakistan's largest bank, HBL , and global financial information and analytics firm S&P Global have launched a new index to track the country's manufacturing sector, the companies said on Friday.】

item.title: Airbnb因强劲的季度业绩和扩张计划而股价大涨
item.description: 周五盘前交易中，Airbnb 股价最高上涨 13.3%，此前这家度假房屋租赁公司第四季度业绩超出华尔街预期，主要受强劲的国际旅游需求提振。【原文：Airbnb shares rose as much as 13.3% in premarket trade on Friday after the vacation home rentals company beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter results, boosted by strong international travel demand.】
